Package circuitikztool

Class Component

java.lang.Object
circuitikztool.Component
public class Component
extends java.lang.Object
Component is meant to be a data object for storing all possible component objects in a single arrayList inside of the class CircuitMaker. For that purpose this class handles path, node, and three terminal components and will be adapted to handle all supported components.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description

    Constructor for component as an option.

    Component​(java.awt.geom.Point2D wireStart, java.awt.geom.Point2D wireEnd, int componentSelected)
    Constructor for PATH components including Wires, resistors, capacitors, etc.

  • Constructor Details

    • Component

      public Component​(int componentSelected)
      Constructor for component as an option. In some instances (latex string builder window) we need to return a component or a command. this constructor allows us to pass a command as a component to logic higher up.
      Parameters:
      componentSelected -

    • Component

      public Component​(java.awt.geom.Point2D position, int componentSelected)
      Constructor for NON-PATH components, requires only a position and a selected component value. consult the constants at the top of the class for valid input values to this function
      Parameters:
      position - position (in terms of the circuitikz placement) where the component would be placed
      componentSelected - component selected, consult constant values above for valid non-path components.

    • Component

      public Component​(java.awt.geom.Point2D wireStart, java.awt.geom.Point2D wireEnd, int componentSelected)
      Constructor for PATH components including Wires, resistors, capacitors, etc. Please consult the defined constants in CircuitMaker to determine proper input values. Non-path components should not use this constructor, the fact that this constructor throws an error when a non path component is passed into it is important to the functioning of the program. this constructor also serves as the "ultimate list" of which components are path components and which components are not path components, please see isPathComponent()
      Parameters:
      wireStart - starting position of the path component (position is in terms of circuitikz coordinates)
      wireEnd - ending position of the path component (position is in terms of circuitikz coordinates)
      componentSelected - desired PATH component to be created, see constants at the top of this class for acceptable values

      public int getDeviceID()

      public java.lang.String toXML()

    • resetStatics

      public static void resetStatics()

    • isPathComponent

      public boolean isPathComponent()
      For components that are already initalized this function identifies a component as path or not-path
      Returns:
      true if path component, false if not.

    • isPathComponent

      public static boolean isPathComponent​(int componentIndex)
      Since the circuit maker class will need to know which indexes are pathing components and which ones aren't we use this function to test a given index to determine whether or not a component is a path component. This relys on the constructor's being properly split between pathing and non pathing components.
      Parameters:
      componentIndex - component index relating to one of the constants defined at the top of CircuitMaker class
      Returns:
      true if path component, false if not path component

    • paint

      public void paint​(java.awt.Graphics g2d, double gridSize, java.awt.geom.Point2D offset, boolean selected)
      Paints the component to the schematic window, Since the schematic window allows for variable grid size and for the user to move the schematic around it requires the current grid size, the current offset (position of the origin relative to 0,0) and the position whether or not the component is selected (selected components are highlighted in a different color in the schematicWindow)
      Parameters:
      g2d - Graphics object for the components to be draw onto
      gridSize - current gridSize of the graphics object, this variable allows for the components to scale relatively
      offset - current offset of the grid which is changed when the user pans around the schematic
      selected - whether or not this component is currently selected

      public java.lang.String getComponentLabel()
      Returns:
      component label string

      public void setComponentLabel​(java.lang.String text)
      sets the component label
      Parameters:
      text - String the component label should be set to

    • getLatexString

      public java.lang.String getLatexString()
      returns the latex parameters of the current component
      Returns:
      latex parameter string of the current component

    • isFet

      public boolean isFet()
      FETs need some special treatment in the latex output, this function returns true if the device is a FET device and false otherwise
      Returns:
      true if FET device

    • setLatexString

      public void setLatexString​(java.lang.String text)
      sets the latex parameters of the current component
      Parameters:
      text - latex parameter string to pass into the current component

    • getStart

      public java.awt.geom.Point2D getStart()
      returns the beginning coordinate of a path component, throws IllegalStateException if component is not a path component
      Returns:
      starting coordinate (in circuitikz coordinates) of the current path component

    • getEnd

      public java.awt.geom.Point2D getEnd()
      returns the end coordinate of a path component, throws IllegalStateException if component is not a path component
      Returns:
      starting coordinate (in circuitikz coordinates) of the current path component

      Returns:
      component label string with position information

    • getLatexLine

      public java.lang.String getLatexLine()
      outputs the formatted LaTeX line representing this component, in special cases this function may return multiple lines of LaTeX code
      Returns:
      Circuitikz code representing current component

    • drawTransistor

      public static void drawTransistor​(java.awt.Graphics g2d, double gridSize, double xPos, double yPos, boolean selected)
      draws the transistor at an x and y position (in CircuiTikz coordinates) to the schematic window, must
      Parameters:
      g2d - graphics object to be drawn onto
      gridSize - current size of the grid
      xPos - x position in circuitikz coordinates
      yPos - y position in circuitikz coordinates
      selected - boolean indicating whether or not the transistor should be drawn as a selected component

      public static void drawTransformer​(java.awt.Graphics g2d, double gridSize, double xPos, double yPos, boolean selected)

    • drawOpamp

      public static void drawOpamp​(java.awt.Graphics g2d, double gridSize, double xPos, double yPos, boolean selected, int component)
      draws the transistor at an x and y position (in CircuiTikz coordinates) to the schematic window, must
      Parameters:
      g2d - graphics object to be drawn onto
      gridSize - current size of the grid
      xPos - x position in circuitikz coordinates
      yPos - y position in circuitikz coordinates
      selected - boolean indicating whether or not the transistor should be drawn as a selected component
      component - integer representing the component itself, since 5 terminal and 3 terminal opamps need to be drawn differently. (uses constants defined at the top of Component class)
